Wild_Horses_(American_country_band):
{{Short description|none}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Wild Horses | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Texas]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1989-present | label = [[Epic Records|Epic]], Persimmon | website = http://www.wildhorsesband.com | current_members = Lon Holland
Steve Kellough
Michael Blake Mahler
Ralph McCauley
Angela Rae
Chris Sigmon | past_members = Joe Lee Koenig }} '''Wild Horses''' is an American [[country music]] band composed of Lon Holland ([[accordion]], [[percussion instrument|percussion]]), Steve Kellough ([[bass guitar]]), Michael Blake Mahler ([[lead guitar]], vocals), Ralph McCauley ([[drum kit|drums]]), Angela Rae ([[lead vocals]]), and Chris Sigmon (steel, fiddle, & [[Dobro]]).{{cite web |url=http://www.wildhorsesband.com/aboutus.htm |title=Wild Horses: About Us |accessdate=2008-03-28 |work=WildHorses.com |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080706111228/http://www.wildhorsesband.com/aboutus.htm |archivedate = 2008-07-06}}{{cite web |url=http://www.rlc.cc.il.us/pressroom/newsstory.php?id=507 |title=Country and blues take center stage at BBQ showdown |accessdate=2008-05-06 |date=2005-06-03 |work=Rend Lake College}} Mahler and Rae are husband and wife, and guitarist Joe Lee Koenig was formerly a member.{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc.|year=2008|pages=462|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} Founded in 1989 in the state of [[Texas]],{{cite web|url=http://www.primesourceentertainment.com/bands/featured/wild_horses.html |title=Featured band: Wild Horses |accessdate=2008-03-03 |work=Prime Source Entertainment |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061123172826/http://www.primesourceentertainment.com/bands/featured/wild_horses.html |archivedate=November 23, 2006 }} the band signed to [[Epic Records]] in 2002, releasing their debut single "I Will Survive" that year. The song went on to peak at No. 46 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Hot Country Singles & Tracks (now [[Hot Country Songs]]) charts, and was included on a compilation album entitled ''Dancin' with Thunder'', which was issued in association with [[Professional Bull Riders]].{{cite web |url=http://countrymusic.about.com/library/bldancinwiththunderrev.htm |title=CD Review: Dancin' With Thunder - Various Artists |accessdate=2008-03-28 |last=Huenke |first= Trisha |work=[[About.com]]}} An album, ''Frontier Free for All'', was released in 2003 on Persimmon Records. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Frontier Free for All'' | * Release date: April 8, 2003 * Label: Persimmon Records |- ! scope="row"| ''Unbroken'' | * Release date: June 26, 2007 * Label: Dreamkeeper Records |- ! scope="row"| ''KMA..Goodbye'' | * Release date: May 21, 2010 * Label: Dreamkeeper Records |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Single ! colspan="1"| Peak positions ! rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="60"| [[Hot Country Songs|US Country]] |- | 2001 ! scope="row"| "I Will Survive" | 46 | align="left"| ''Dancin' with Thunder'' |- | rowspan="2"| 2003 ! scope="row"| "You Gotta Ride" | 窶能n| align="left" rowspan="2"| ''Frontier Free for All'' |- ! scope="row"| "Safely Home" | 窶能n|- | 2008 ! scope="row"| "Surrounded" | 窶能n| align="left"| ''Unbroken'' |- | colspan="4" style="font-size:8pt"| "窶能
